title: 114_s1666
content: Extension of bonus depreciation. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 extends the dates for bonus depreciation, with changes to dates in various subparagraphs and clauses. Conforming amendments are made to headings in the Code to reflect the new dates. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to extend bonus depreciation dates, with changes to various subparagraphs and clauses to reflect new dates. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to extend bonus depreciation dates, with changes to various subparagraphs and clauses to reflect new dates, specifically amending section 1400N(d)(3) and section 168(k) to update dates to January 1, 2017. Special rules are also introduced for round 5 extension property. The amendment extends bonus depreciation dates and introduces special rules for round 5 extension property, with separate computations for eligible qualified property and round 5 extension property placed in service before specific dates. A taxpayer can make an election regarding these provisions. The amendment introduces special rules for round 5 extension property, allowing taxpayers to elect for this provision to apply. The term 'round 5 extension property' refers to property eligible solely due to the extension of a special allowance under the Internal Revenue Code. The amendment in section 1(d) of the Act defines the special maximum increase amount for round 5 extension property placed in service by a corporation. It is the lesser of 50 percent of the minimum tax credit under section 53(b) for the first taxable year after December 31, 2014, or the minimum tax credit for that year based on specific criteria. The amendments made by this section apply to property placed in service after December 31, 2014, in taxable years ending after that date.
